formattedAddress: Liggett Terrace, 517 Clayton Rd, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: Liggett Terrace, 517 Clayton Rd, New York, NY 10004, USA

editorialSummary.text: Open-air food court featuring rotating vendors offering a choice of international eats & drinks.

originalText.text: The Liggett Terrace Food Court consists of various food trucks and carts, offering a decent array of popular NYC dining options from burgers and fries to Korean fusion to Peruvian hot dogs to teriyaki bowls. I purchased a teriyaki super food bowl with steak (Terry and Yaki, $14) and was pleasantly surprised by both the great taste and portions. The steak was moist and plentiful, and the flavors blended well.  For a drink, I got a sparkling coffee float (Joe Coffee, $8) which didn't quite live up to its price, but was refreshing nonetheless. Prices are on par with most NYC food truck prices, but may induce sticker shock in tourists. Credit cards are widely accepted, but if you need cash there's an ATM nearby. There are more food options available on weekends than weekdays, but there are also more crowds on weekends so expect lines. Liggett Terrace has limited seating but there's plenty of green space to picnic throughout Governors Island.

originalText.text: Nice selection of popular local food trucks including Korean fusion, Venezuelan hot dogs, Jamaican chicken, Ethiopian platter, American grill, local ice cream and brewery. For the ones I tried they are decent for the price - you certainly won't make a trip for it. I recommend the Venezuelan hot dog, PERROS y vainas. The dogs have interesting flavors and the lemonade are refreshing.

text.text: Nice selection of popular local food trucks including Korean fusion, Venezuelan hot dogs, Jamaican chicken, Ethiopian platter, American grill, local ice cream and brewery. For the ones I tried they are decent for the price - you certainly won't make a trip for it. I recommend the Venezuelan hot dog, PERROS y vainas. The dogs have interesting flavors and the lemonade are refreshing.

originalText.text: 3 stars because the mac and cheese was good. The food is ridiculously over priced. The pita salad was just a bunch of greens stuffed into pita bread like a damn sandwich. It was gross and dry. They could have at least put some chicken in that. I have never had a salad sandwich before and I never will again. I understand that when you go to places like this the prices are going to be up there, but all I ask is that you try to make the food match the price. They did a very lazy job with a salad for crying out loud. No sauce or dressing provided either. They have table service to bring you your food when it's ready but if you need napkins or condiments you have to come back to the cart. That makes no sense.

originalText.text: I went later in the afternoon so there was no line. You must be patient to get the food you want cooked fresh but its worth it. I went to the Jamaican Food Truck and get a vegan gyro. It was pretty quick considering and my goodness it was sooooo yummy. Highly recommended.

text.text: I went later in the afternoon so there was no line. You must be patient to get the food you want cooked fresh but its worth it. I went to the Jamaican Food Truck and get a vegan gyro. It was pretty quick considering and my goodness it was sooooo yummy. Highly recommended.

originalText.text: I was heading towards a 4 star, but then my daughter wanted to get something more to eat. We asked for a bun with pickles and cheese, sans meat. The meat must make up half the cost of the $10 menu item, but there was no price adjustment offered for taking just a light bun, a slice of cheese and a few pieces of pickled cucumber.
